Test Description: Run command with lower rpm version
Notes / Detailed Description: This is hard requirement : rpm should be present on master node and absolute path is required

Test Description: Run command with same rpm version

1. Copy rpm on non-master node
2. Run the command from master node

1. Copy rpm on master node
2 Run the command from testserver3 or non-master node
Test --node-list option by providing (number of nodes in cluster) - 1 nodes to the command
Notes / Detailed Description:
This option provides facility to update rpm on selected nodes. What if user updates only two nodes in cluster ?
Naveen :  If the user wants to make sure the upgrade goes through smoothly on a smaller set of nodes before upgrading the remaining nodes.

Test Description: Test --force option of update command (This option is for downgrade rpm)
Run the command by using --no-reboot option and check whether it indeed does not reboot nodes
Run the command by using --abort-on-failure option

Notes / Detailed Description: How to check whether dctl indeed does not drain nodes ?

Scenario / Category:
Please update this cell according to current requirement

From build-x.x.x.rpm to build.y.y.y.rpm
Test Description:
1. Disable docker/enable [depending on current requirement ] 
2. Create resources (use different fs type for storage related resource : ext4,ext3,xfs)
        a. iperf-rc : 8 pods
        b. fio-rc : static provisioning 4 pods.
        c. fio-rc: dynamic provisioning 4 pods.
        e. create lcv from above volumes's snapshot (step c) and create fio rc for them.  After upgrade create snapshot of this lcv.
        f. fio-rc-mirror : static provisioning 4 pods.
        g. fio-rc-mirror: dynamic provisioning 4 pods.
        h. create lcv from above volumes's snapshot (step g) [Create fio rc for these lcv after upgrade]
        i. nfs-client-rc
        j. iSCSI-rc (Windows target details given in desription.)
        k. Deployments of fio.
        l. Statefulset with endpoint prefix in different namespace. 
        m. Statefulset fio with multiple volumes.
        n. Deployment nginx
        o. Create 4 fio rc pod mirror count 1, use fio-verify image. [Verify data after upgrade. Then increase the mirror count and verify data on new plexes.]
        p. Create 4 fio rc pod with mirror count 3, use fio-vrify image [ verify data after upgrade]
        q. KVM pods. (one pod per node.)
        r.  Create resources of maria-db, fluentd and zabbix using helm chart.
        s. Create a local user, namespce  with role list : volume-edit,volume claim edit, container-edit. Create one rc iperf rc, one rc fio-pvc (static), one rc fio-pvc (dynamic).
        t. Create windows auth server. Create a remote user, namespce  with role list : volume-edit,volume claim edit, container-edit. Create one rc iperf rc, one rc fio-pvc (static), one rc fio-pvc (dynamic). 
        u. Create linux auth server. Create a remote user, namespce  with role list : volume-edit,volume claim edit, container-edit. Create one rc iperf rc, one rc fio-pvc (static), one rc fio-pvc (dynamic).
 
3. Upgrade the cluster using given steps  : https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZYccu8_MYeNHmdxBeGTw9O_jPEcyqQk2g_fDwdMUkas/edit?ts=5cafe816#
Notes / Detailed Description:
iscsi target details: targetportal: 172.16.32.164:3260, IQN:iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:f196de8d4db5



Check at least basic things after upgrade : 
a. check if all rc,deployments/statefullsets are in running state and all are passing data. 
b. try to create pods for lcvs (created in step h) 
c. check if nfs client is working fine after upgrade. 
e. check if all pods in different namespaces are in running state and transferrring data. 
f. try to increase mirror count of some volumes after rpm upgrade and checksum of all plexes should be equal.

Test Description:
1) Create local, remote and mirrored volumes. Attach them
2) Run IOs on all the volumes. 
3) Create snapshots of all the volumes (snap1)
4) Calculate cksum of these volumes across all plexes (cksum1)
5) Run IOs on all the volumes with different pattern. 
6) Detach all the volumes. Upgrade the cluster.
7) Attach all the volumes. Run some more IOs.
8) Detach all the volumes. Restore all the volumes using snapshot (snap1)
9) Calculate cksum of all the volumes across all the plexes (cksum2)
10) cksum2 should match with cksum1
Notes / Detailed Description: DWS-4123: Says, if there is remotely attached volumes, we need to manually detach them before upgrade.its fix is available in 2.0.2
